summary: The document is a memorandum from 28 February 1961, detailing a covert operation under the REDSKIN project aimed at recruiting and training agents under a nonofficial cover. It outlines the use of a security-cleared employment service in Pittsburgh for initial psychological assessments by two psychologists under their true names. Further training and assessments are planned in New York and Baltimore, with the objective of processing 30 to 35 agents before the summer season.
key_findings: The REDSKIN project involves a covert operation focusing on agent recruitment and training.
Psychological assessments are central to selecting REDSKIN agents.
Initial assessments will be conducted undercover via a cleared employment service in Pittsburgh.
Training and additional assessments are scheduled in New York and Baltimore to avoid Washington, D.C.
The operation aims to recruit 30 to 35 agents before the summer, indicating a time-sensitive mission.
